greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of (theta_3(q^(1/2))^k + theta_4(q^(1/2))^k)/2.
link: J. H. Conway and N. J. A. Sloane, Sphere Packings, Lattices and Groups, Springer-Verlag, p. 118.
formula: G.f. of column k: (theta_3(q^(1/2))^k + theta_4(q^(1/2))^k)/2, where theta_() is the Jacobi theta function.
mathematica: Table[Function[k, SeriesCoefficient[(EllipticTheta[3, 0, q^(1/2)]^k + EllipticTheta[4, 0, q^(1/2)]^k)/2, {q, 0, n}]][j - n], {j, 0, 11}, {n, 0, j}] // Flatten
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Dec 28 2017
